quote: Do not seek to find a reason why elections are not possible. Seek to make them possible, and they will be possible.
Elections are held to delude the populace into believing that they are participating in government.
Elections are won by men and women chiefly because most people vote against somebody rather than for somebody.
Elections remind us not only of the rights but the responsibilities of citizenship in a democracy.
Our elections are free, it's in the results where eventually we pay.
There is a sort of exotic preposterousness about a lot of elections, the way arguments are made even cruder.
Where annual elections end where slavery begins.
